definition: to say one and mean just that (idiom); to keep one's word
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
(negative prefix)/not/no
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid

sentences.english: The old squad leader is a man of his word; he never makes a promise he cannot keep.
sentences.chinese: 老班长是说一不二的，他答应的事一定能办到。

sentences.english: But good husbands take their wives at their word.
sentences.chinese: 但好丈夫对妻子总是说一不二。

sentences.english: They had today is sky, say a not two, you never can defy.
sentences.chinese: 他们曾今是天，说一不二，你从不能违抗。

definition: one word worth nine sacred tripods (idiom); words of enormous weight
to follow obediently
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
pass like thunder and move like the wind (idiom); swift and decisive reaction
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to decide alone without consultation/arbitrary/dictatorial
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
unmoved by force or persuasion
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
disobedient to parents
fearing nothing in Heaven or Earth (idiom)/fearless
pinyin: tian1 bu4 pa4 di4 bu4 pa4

definition: bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
to defend sb (a relative, friend or oneself) despite knowing that that person is in the wrong
to keep one's promise/to mean what one says
